## array

### sortByObjectKey

Sort a collection of objects by one of the keys

**Parameters**

-   `data` **[Array][27]&lt;[Object][28]>** 
-   `prop` **[String][29]** 
-   `direction` **[String][29]** defines if sort should be asc or desc

**Examples**

```javascript
const data = [{id: 1, name: "foo"}, {id: 2, name: "abc"}]
sortByObjectKey(data, "name")
// output will be [{id: 2, name: "abc"}, {id: 1, name: "foo"}]
```

Returns **[Array][27]&lt;[Object][28]>** sorted arrray

### filterBy

Filter a collection of objects by one prop

**Parameters**

-   `key` **[String][29]** 
-   `values` **any** 
-   `items` **[Array][27]&lt;[Object][28]>** 

**Examples**

```javascript
const arr = [{a: 1}, {a: 2}, {a: 3}]
filterBy("a", [1, 3], arr);

// The output will be:
// [{a: 1}, {a: 3}]
```

Returns **[Array][27]&lt;[Object][28]>** 

## date

### beautifySeconds

Receive a number of seconds and return an string representing the amount of
hours on the format: 00h00m00s
Examples:
beautifySeconds(60, false) => 01m
beautifyMinutes(120, false) => 02m
beautifyMinutes(3900, false) => 1h05m
beautifyMinutes(3900, true) => 1h05m00s

**Parameters**

-   `seconds` **[Number][30]** 
-   `showSeconds` **[Boolean][31]**  (optional, default `true`)

Returns **[string][32]** 

### beautifyMinutes

-   **See: beautifySeconds
    Works the same way as beautifySeconds, but receive an amount of minutes**

**Parameters**

-   `minutes` **[Number][30]** 
-   `showSeconds` **[Boolean][31]**  (optional, default `true`)

Returns **[String][29]** 

### fromBeutyToSeconds

Receives an duration with the format 00h00m00s and returns the amount
of seconds. The inverse of beautifySeconds

**Parameters**

-   `theTime` **[String][29]** 

Returns **[Number][30]** 

### daysBetween

Receive two dates and returns the amount of days between them
Dates on the format supported by the Date constructor

**Parameters**

-   `startDateString` **[String][29]** 
-   `endDateString` **[String][29]** 

Returns **[Number][30]** 

### curdate

Returns the current date on the format: yyyy-mm-dd

Returns **[String][29]** 

### firstDayOfTheMonth

Returns the first day of the current month on the format: yyyy-dd-mm

Returns **[String][29]** 

### lastDayOfTheMonth

Returns the last day of the month on the format: yyyy-mm-dd
It accepts an optional month and year to get the last day of an particular month

**Parameters**

-   `month` **[String][29]** 
-   `year` **[String][29]** 

Returns **[String][29]** 

## string

### resolveUrl

Add basepath if isn't complete
Consider a complete url when it contains '//'

Examples of complete urls:
[http://google.com][33]
[https://google.com][34]
//google.com

Examples of incomplete urls:
google.com
google
users/create
/users/create

**Parameters**

-   `url` **[String][29]** 
-   `basePath` **[String][29]** basepath to be used, with protocol (optional, default `""`)

Returns **[String][29]** 

### ucfirst

Makes string capitalized

**Parameters**

-   `string` **[String][29]** 

Returns **[string][32]** 

### capitalize

-   **See: App.helpers.string.ucfirst**

**Parameters**

-   `string` **[String][29]** 

Returns **[String][29]** 

### ucwords

Makes every word from string capitalized

**Parameters**

-   `string` **[String][29]** 

Returns **[string][32]** 

### excerpt

Will crop the text to fit the maxLength provided. Will try to not break any words
and add "..." on the end of the string

**Parameters**

-   `text` **[String][29]** 
-   `maxLength` **[Number][30]** 

Returns **[String][29]** 

### uuid

generares a UUID
Ref: [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/105034/create-guid-uuid-in-javascript][35]

Returns **[String][29]** 

## object

### getFlattened

Get element from obj by string path
Example:
Given the object let a = {a: {b: 1}}
When you do getFlattened("a.b", a)
Then you get the number 1.

**Parameters**

-   `path` **[string][32]** specify the key of the object you want
-   `obj` **[Object][28]** reference object
-   `defaultValue` **any** value to return if key was not found. Default is null (optional, default `null`)

Returns **any** 

### getFirstFlattened

-   **See: getFlattened**

Receives a list of paths and use getFlattened to get the first existent value

**Parameters**

-   `paths` **[Array][27]&lt;[String][29]>** 
-   `obj` **[Object][28]** 
-   `defaultValue` **any**  (optional, default `null`)

Returns **any** 

### setFlattened

-   **See: getFlattened
    Similar to getFlattened, but it set the value instead of return it.
    Example:
    Given the object let b = {a: {b: 1}}
    When you do setFlattened("a.b", 2)
    Then you get {a: {b: 2}}**

**Parameters**

-   `path` **[String][29]** 
-   `newValue` **any** 
-   `obj` **[Object][28]** 

Returns **any** 

### firstKey

Get first key of an object or null if it doesn't have keys

**Parameters**

-   `obj` **[Object][28]** 

Returns **any** 

### collectionContains

Checks if an array of objetcs contain another object (even partially)

**Parameters**

-   `collection` **[Array][27]&lt;[Object][28]>** 
-   `userFilters` **[Object][28]** object to find
-   `detailed` **[Boolean][31]** if true will return an object with deails about the searc
-   `ignoreCase` **[Boolean][31]** if true, will ignore case when matching strings

Returns **([Boolean][31] \| [Array][27])** 

### flatten

Transforms an nested object into an flat object with dotted notation
Example: flatten({a: {b: 2}}) will return {"a.b": 2}

**Parameters**

-   `obj` **([Object][28] \| [Array][27])** the source object or array
-   `separator` **[string][32]**  (optional, default `"."`)
-   `prefix` **[string][32]** All keys will be prefixed with this arg (optional, default `""`)

Returns **[Object][28]** 

### isCyclic

Check if any given object has some kind of cyclic reference.

**Parameters**

-   `obj` **[Object][28]** the source to be checked

Returns **[boolean][31]**
